intro: Styphelia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered heath, is a low-growing shrub native to the western coast of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and azaleas. The plant typically has small, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands and forest understories. Styphelia pauciflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
